content: If a car travels at an average speed of 60 mph for 4 hours, how far has it traveled?

If a car travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour for 4 hours, the distance it has traveled can be calculated using the formula:

\[ \text{distance} = \text{speed} \times \text{time} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{distance} = 60 \, \text{mph} \times 4 \, \text{hours} = 240 \, \text{miles} \]

So, the car has traveled 240 miles.
